citations.narrative:
A primary enclosure contains carpet that is in disrepair with frayed edges. An enclosure housing an adult female Golden
Retriever has carpet with frayed edges. Frayed edges can be injurious to the regulated animal as they could ingest the
material or it could cause entrapment. All surfaces must be maintained on a regular basis. Surfaces of housing facilities—
including houses, dens, and other furniture-type fixtures and objects within the facility—that cannot be readily cleaned and
sanitized, must be replaced when worn or soiled. The carpets must be maintained without frayed edges.

The licensee is not maintaining complete medical records for two adult dogs. Records indicate an adult female Golden
Retriever (ID#6973) and an adult female Golden Retriever (ID#2943) were receiving treatments for heartworm disease.
Treatments include Prednisone, Ivermectin, and Doxycycline. There are no records with the names of the treatments
administered and the dates the treatments were given. Failure to maintain adequate medical records may interfere with
the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the animals are receiving adequate veterinary care. Complete medical records
must be maintained and include the names of all vaccines and treatments administered and the dates of administration.
Correct by documenting all treatments given and ensure that medical records are complete and contain the required
information.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
n

narrative:
3.1(c)(2)  Repeat
   
Housing facilities, general. 
A primary enclosure contains carpet that is in disrepair with frayed edges. An enclosure housing an adult female Golden 
Retriever has carpet with frayed edges. Frayed edges can be injurious to the regulated animal as they could ingest the 
material or it could cause entrapment. All surfaces must be maintained on a regular basis. Surfaces of housing facilities—
including houses, dens, and other furniture-type fixtures and objects within the facility—that cannot be readily cleaned and 
sanitized, must be replaced when worn or soiled. The carpets must be maintained without frayed edges. 
3.13(b)(3)  Repeat
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee is not maintaining complete medical records for two adult dogs. Records indicate an adult female Golden 
Retriever (ID#6973) and an adult female Golden Retriever (ID#2943) were receiving treatments for heartworm disease. 
Treatments include Prednisone, Ivermectin, and Doxycycline. There are no records with the names of the treatments 
administered and the dates the treatments were given. Failure to maintain adequate medical records may interfere with 
the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the animals are receiving adequate veterinary care. Complete medical records 
must be maintained and include the names of all vaccines and treatments administered and the dates of administration. 
Correct by documenting all treatments given and ensure that medical records are complete and contain the required 
information. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
